clearcontrol.microscope

Interface MicroscopeInterface<Q extends QueueInterface>

  • Type Parameters:
    Q - queue type
    All Superinterfaces:
    HasChangeListenerInterface<VirtualDevice>, NameableInterface, QueueDeviceInterface<Q>, ReadOnlyNameableInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MicroscopeBase

    public interface MicroscopeInterface<Q extends QueueInterface>
extends NameableInterface, QueueDeviceInterface<Q>, HasChangeListenerInterface<VirtualDevice>
    MicroscopeInterface is a generic interface for all microscopes types.
    Author:
    royer

        java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Object> getCurrentTask()

        current task atomic reference

      • useRecycler

        void useRecycler(java.lang.String pName,
                 int pMinimumNumberOfAvailableStacks,
                 int pMaximumNumberOfAvailableStacks,
                 int pMaximumNumberOfLiveStacks)
        Uses a recycler with given parameters. This recycler will be used for all subsequent plays. if teh recycler does not exist yet, it is created.
        Parameters:
        pName - recycler name
        pMinimumNumberOfAvailableStacks - minimum number of available stacks
        pMaximumNumberOfAvailableStacks - maximum number of available stacks
        pMaximumNumberOfLiveStacks - maximum number of live stacks

      • playQueueAndWait

        java.lang.Boolean playQueueAndWait(Q pQueue,
                                   long pTimeOut,
                                   java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit pTimeUnit)
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                   java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                   java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Plays queue for all devices, and waits for playback to finish.
        Parameters:
        pQueue - queue to play
        pTimeOut - timeout
        pTimeUnit - time unit for timeout
        Returns:
        true if successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interupted
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - if execution occured during async execution
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if timeout

      • playQueueAndWaitForStacks

        java.lang.Boolean playQueueAndWaitForStacks(Q pQueue,
                                            long pTimeOut,
                                            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit pTimeUnit)
                                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                            java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                            java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Plays queue for all devices, waits for playback to finish as well as waits for stacks to be delivered.
        Parameters:
        pQueue - queue to play
        pTimeOut - timeout time
        pTimeUnit - timeout unit
        Returns:
        true if successfull
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interupted
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - if execution occured during async execution
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if timeout

      • getCameraPixelSizeInNanometerVariable

        Variable<java.lang.Double> getCameraPixelSizeInNanometerVariable(int pCameraIndex)
        Returns the size in nanometer (anisotropic XY) of a pixel. this is the actual physical size in the sample - thus taking into account overall magnification. The size is returned wrapped into a Variable.
        Parameters:
        pCameraIndex - camera index
        Returns:
        size in nanometer as a Variable
